document_title: Heart failure: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_content:
Symptoms of the disease may be different for each person. They can start suddenly or develop gradually over weeks or months. (2)
The most common symptoms of heart failure are:
Difficulty breathing: can occur immediately after the patient is active or at rest; More severe is difficulty breathing when lying with the head low, paroxysmal difficulty breathing at night causing the patient to wake up.; Fatigue: the patient may feel tired and weak most of the time;; Swollen feet and ankles: due to fluid retention, may be mild in the morning and worse at the end of the day.
Other symptoms include:
Persistent cough that may be worse at night; sometimes coughing up blood or pink foam; Wheeze;; Bloating;; Loss of appetite;; Weight gain or loss;; Dizziness and fainting;; Tachycardia, arrhythmia or palpitations;; Some patients may also experience depression and anxiety and insomnia.
subsection_data:
